conclusion: Coach bus travels at 20 m/s, puppy is 45 meters ahead, driver takes 0.5 seconds to react.
Velocity-time graph shows a straight line from 20 m/s at t=0 to 0 m/s at t=4.5 seconds.
Graph should have two parts: horizontal line during reaction time and straight line with negative slope during deceleration.
During reaction time (0.5 seconds), bus continues at 20 m/s.
From t=0.5 seconds onward, bus decelerates uniformly until it stops at t=4.5 seconds.
Need to calculate total distance bus travels from t=0 until it stops.
Distance is area under velocity-time graph from t=0 to when bus stops.
Area under curve consists of rectangle (reaction time) and triangle (deceleration).
Total distance traveled by bus is 10 m + 40 m = 50 meters.
Bus travels 50 meters before stopping, puppy is 45 meters ahead.
Bus will pass 45-meter mark, but might stop before reaching puppy.
Need to find position of bus at different times to see if it reaches puppy.
Alternatively, calculate distance bus travels up to puppy's position.
Find time at which bus reaches puppy's position to verify if it stops.
At t=0.5 s, distance to puppy is 45 m - 10 m = 35 meters.
During deceleration, velocity is v(t) = v0 - a*t.
